        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">20</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">ALCON,
INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Notes
to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements (Unaudited)</font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(in
millions, except share and per share data)</font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">million
shares at the first stage price of $143.18 per share, and (ii) Nestl&#233; a put
option to sell to Novartis all but 4.1 million of its remaining Alcon shares to
Novartis at the lower of Novartis's call price of $181 per share or a 20.5%
premium above the then-market price of Alcon shares, which will be calculated as
the average market price of Alcon shares during the five trading days
immediately preceding the exercise date of the put option, with the 4.1 million
share balance to be sold at the first stage closing price of $143.18 per
share.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
consummation of a purchase and sale transaction under the Purchase and Option
Agreement is subject to regulatory approvals.&#160;&#160;The consummation would
trigger certain change of control provisions in the Company's share-based awards
plan (including the vesting of certain outstanding share-based awards), certain
retirement plans for Company employees and other agreements.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">
          <tr valign="top">
            <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(14)&#160;&#160;</font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Commitments
      and Contingencies</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>
      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Alcon has
joined with its commercial partners in filing six patent infringement actions
against four different generic drug companies.&#160;&#160;All of these generic
drug companies are seeking U.S. Food and Drug Administration ("FDA") approval to
market generic versions of Alcon products, under what is known as an Abbreviated
New Drug Application ("ANDA").</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The first
infringement action was filed after Alcon received notice that Teva
Pharmaceuticals USA, Inc. had filed an ANDA seeking approval to sell a generic
version of Alcon's <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Vigamox</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font>
antibiotic ophthalmic solution.&#160;&#160;Moxifloxacin, the primary ingredient
in <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Vigamox</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font>, is
licensed to Alcon by Bayer HealthCare AG.&#160;&#160;As part of its ANDA, Teva
challenged three patents covering Alcon's innovator product <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Vigamox</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font>.&#160;&#160;Two
of the patents are owned by Alcon's licensor, Bayer HealthCare AG, and the
third, which expires in 2020, is owned by Alcon.&#160;&#160;The two Bayer
HealthCare patents were also the subject of another Teva ANDA seeking approval
to sell a generic version of Bayer HealthCare's systemic moxifloxacin product,
Avelox<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font>.&#160;&#160;Suit
was filed by Alcon and Bayer HealthCare as co-plaintiffs against Teva relative
to the <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Vigamox</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font> ANDA on
April 5, 2006 in the U.S. District Court in Delaware.&#160;&#160;Bayer
HealthCare subsequently filed suit in the same court relative to the Avelox<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font> ANDA,
and the two suits were merged.&#160;&#160;Trial was scheduled to begin February
26, 2008, but the dispute between Bayer HealthCare and Teva relative to the two
Bayer HealthCare patents was resolved by settlement on the eve of
trial.&#160;&#160;Under the terms of the settlement, Teva acknowledged the
validity and enforceability of both Bayer HealthCare patents, and further
acknowledged that its proposed generic ophthalmic product would infringe both
patents.&#160;&#160;Teva has therefore relinquished any claim that it is
entitled to market the generic ophthalmic product prior to September 4,
2014.&#160;&#160;Alcon remains the exclusive ophthalmic licensee under the Bayer
HealthCare patents.&#160;&#160;The trial relative to the Alcon patent began on
February 28, 2008 and concluded on March 6, 2008.&#160;&#160;Judgment is not
expected until the first half of 2009.&#160;&#160;Should Teva succeed in
overcoming the Alcon patent and secure FDA approval, it would be entitled to
sell a generic moxifloxacin product that would compete with Alcon's <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Vigamox</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font> product
in the United States on September 4, 2014, well before the 2020 expiration of
the Alcon patent.&#160;&#160;Such competition would be expected to impact
significantly the Company's sales and profits.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
second patent infringement action was filed after Alcon received notice that
Apotex, a Canadian-based generic drug company, had filed an ANDA challenging one
of the patents covering Alcon's <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Patanol</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font>
anti-allergy eye product.&#160;&#160;Alcon's raw material supplier, Kyowa Hakko
Kirin Co., Ltd., holds another U.S. patent that has not been challenged in this
case and expires on December 18, 2010.&#160;&#160;The patent that Apotex has
challenged, which is co-owned by Alcon and Kyowa, will expire in
2015.&#160;&#160;Alcon and Kyowa, as co-plaintiffs, filed suit against Apotex
Inc. and Apotex Corp. on November 15, 2006 in the U.S. District Court in
Indianapolis, Indiana.&#160;&#160;As a result of the lawsuit filing, the FDA
must delay any approval of the Apotex ANDA for 30 months unless the litigation
is earlier resolved or the court modifies the 30-month stay on FDA
approval.&#160;&#160;Trial is currently rescheduled for July 27,
2009.&#160;&#160;Should Apotex succeed in overcoming the challenged patent and
secure FDA approval, it would not be entitled to begin selling a generic
olopatadine product that would compete with Alcon's <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Patanol</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font> product
in the United States until December 18, 2010.&#160;&#160;Such competition would
be expected to impact significantly the Company's sales and
profits.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">21</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">ALCON,
INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Notes
to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements (Unaudited)</font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(in
millions, except share and per share data)</font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The third
patent infringement action was filed after Alcon received notice on October 1,
2007 that Barr Laboratories, Inc. had filed an ANDA challenging the patents
underlying Alcon's <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Patanol</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font>
product.&#160;&#160;Unlike the Apotex ANDA described above, which is challenging
only the patent jointly owned by Kyowa and Alcon, the Barr ANDA is also
challenging Kyowa's composition patent on olopatadine, the active agent in <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Patanol</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font>.&#160;&#160;&#160;Alcon
and Kyowa filed suit in the Federal District Court in Indianapolis (where the
Apotex case is pending) on October 23, 2007.&#160;&#160;As a result of the
lawsuit filing, the FDA must delay any approval of the Barr ANDA for 30 months
unless the litigation is earlier resolved or the court modifies the 30-month
stay on FDA approval.&#160;&#160;The 30-month period after which the FDA could
approve Barr&#8217;s generic product will expire at the end of March 2010, nine months
before the Kyowa composition patent expires.&#160;&#160;Trial is currently
scheduled for late April 2010.&#160;&#160;Should Barr succeed in overcoming both
of the challenged patents and secure FDA approval, it and Apotex may be entitled
to begin selling a generic olopatadine product that would compete with Alcon's
<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Patanol</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font> product
in the United States prior to December 18, 2010.&#160;&#160;Such competition
would be expected to impact significantly the Company's sales and
profits.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
fourth patent infringement action was filed after Alcon received notice in late
November 2008 that Barr Laboratories, Inc. had filed an ANDA challenging the
patents underlying Alcon&#8217;s <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Pataday</font>&#8482; once daily
olopatadine product.&#160;&#160;The Barr ANDA is challenging the patent jointly
owned by Kyowa and Alcon (described above), as well as two later issued patents
owned by Alcon that cover the <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Pataday</font>&#8482;
formulation.&#160;&#160;Of the two Alcon patents, the latest expiry date is
November 2023.&#160;&#160;Barr is not challenging the Kyowa patent on
olopatadine that expires in December 2010.&#160;&#160;&#160;Alcon and Kyowa
filed suit in the Federal District Court in Indianapolis (where the Apotex and
Barr <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Patanol</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#174;</font>
product cases are pending) on January 8, 2009.&#160;&#160;As a result of the
lawsuit filing, the FDA must delay any approval of the Barr ANDA for 30 months
unless the litigation is earlier resolved or the court modifies the 30-month
stay on FDA approval.&#160;&#160;The 30-month period after which the FDA could
approve Barr&#8217;s generic product should expire in May 2011.&#160;&#160;Trial has
not yet been scheduled in this case.&#160;&#160;If Barr succeeds in overcoming
all of the challenged patents and secures FDA approval, it would be entitled to
begin selling a generic olopatadine product that would compete with Alcon&#8217;s
<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Pataday</font>&#8482; product in the
United States on December 18, 2010.&#160;&#160;Such competition would be
expected to impact significantly the Company's sales and profits.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The fifth
and sixth ANDA patent suits were filed February 2, 2009 in the U.S. District
Court in Indianapolis against Apotex and Sandoz respectively.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Alcon
received notice January 12, 2009, that Apotex has followed Barr in filing an
ANDA challenging the patents underlying Alcon&#8217;s <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Pataday</font>&#8482; once daily
olopatadine product.&#160;&#160;Like Barr's ANDA, the Apotex ANDA is challenging
the patent jointly owned by Kyowa and Alcon (described above), as well as two
later issued patents owned by Alcon that cover the <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Pataday</font>&#8482;
formulation.&#160;&#160;Apotex is not challenging the Kyowa patent on
olopatadine that expires in December 2010.&#160;&#160;Because the suit was filed
within the statutory 45-day period, the FDA must delay any approval of the
Apotex ANDA until June 2011, unless the litigation is earlier resolved or the
court modifies the 30-month stay on FDA approval.&#160;&#160;Trial has not yet
been scheduled in this case.&#160;&#160;If Apotex succeeds in overcoming both of
the challenged patents and secures FDA approval, and after the expiration of
Barr's potential 180-day "first filer" exclusivity period, it would be entitled
to begin selling a generic olopatadine product that would compete with Alcon&#8217;s
<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Pataday</font>&#8482; product in the
United States in April 2011.&#160;&#160;Such competition would be expected to
impact the Company's sales and profits.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Alcon
received notice on January 15, 2009 that Sandoz Inc. (an affiliate of Novartis)
has filed an ANDA challenging one of the patents underlying Alcon&#8217;s <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Patanol</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font>
product.&#160;&#160;Similar to the Apotex ANDA on <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Patanol</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super; FONT-STYLE: italic">&#174;</font>,
the Sandoz ANDA is challenging only the patent jointly owned by Kyowa and Alcon,
but not the Kyowa-owned patent on olopatadine, which expires December
2010.&#160;&#160;Because the suit was filed within the statutory 45-day period,
the FDA must delay any approval of the Sandoz ANDA until June 2011 unless the
litigation is earlier resolved or the court modifies the 30-month stay on FDA
approval.&#160;&#160;However, as a third ANDA filer (behind both Apotex and
Barr), Sandoz would not be entitled to receive FDA approval until the expiration
or forfeiture of a 180-day exclusivity period that would be granted to Apotex
(the first filer) if it were successful in its patent
challenge.&#160;&#160;Trial has not yet been scheduled in this
case.&#160;&#160;Subject to the possibility of the 180-day exclusivity period
that could</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">22</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">ALCON,
INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Notes
to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements (Unaudited)</font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(in
millions, except share and per share data)</font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">accrue to
Apotex, if Sandox succeeds in overcoming the challenged patent and secures FDA
approval, it would be entitled to begin selling a generic olopatadine product
that would compete with Alcon&#8217;s <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Patanol</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font> product
in the United States in April 2011.&#160;&#160;Such competition would be
expected to impact the Company's sales and profits.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">By letter
dated March 17, 2009, Alcon received notice that Barr Laboratories, Inc. has
filed a Paragraph IV certification with its ANDA for a generic version of
Alcon's <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">TRAVATAN</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font> product
containing 0.004% travoprost.&#160;&#160;Barr is challenging the following
patents listed in the Orange Book for <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">TRAVATAN</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font>: U.S.
Patent Nos. 5,510,383; 5,631,287; 5,849,792; 5,889,052; and
6,011,062.&#160;&#160;With the exception of the '383 patent, which expires in
2013, all of the patents will expire in December 2014.&#160;&#160;Conservatively
calculated, Alcon's 45-day period to file suit and secure the statutory 30-month
stay on FDA approval of the generic product would be May 1, 2009.&#160;&#160;If
an action is filed within the 45-day period, the FDA must delay any approval of
the Barr ANDA until September 2011, unless the litigation is earlier resolved or
the court modifies the 30-month stay on FDA approval.&#160;&#160;As suit has not
yet been filed, trial has not yet been scheduled in this case.&#160;&#160;Should
Barr succeed in overcoming all of the challenged patents and secure FDA
approval, it would be entitled to begin selling a generic travoprost product
that would compete with Alcon&#8217;s <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">TRAVATAN</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font> product
in the United States.&#160;&#160;Such competition would be expected to impact
the Company's sales and profits.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">By letter
dated April 9, 2009, Sandoz Canada Inc. (an affiliate of Novartis) notified
Alcon Canada that Sandoz has filed an Abbreviated New Drug Submission (ANDS)
seeking approval from the Canadian Minister of Health to market a generic
version of Alcon's <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Patanol</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font>
product.&#160;&#160;The Sandoz ANDS is challenging only one of the two patents
listed in the Canadian Patent Register for the <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Patanol</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font>
product.&#160;&#160;The challenged patent (Canadian Patent No. 2,195,094) is
jointly owned by Kyowa and Alcon and expires in May, 2016.&#160;&#160;Alcon is
currently reviewing the Sandoz notice letter and consulting with outside
counsel.&#160;&#160;If Alcon commences a patent infringement action, regulatory
approval from the Minister of Health will be automatically delayed for 24 months
unless the litigation is earlier resolved or the court modifies the 24-month
stay on such approval.&#160;&#160;In the event of litigation, should Sandoz
succeed in overcoming the challenged patent and secure Ministry of Health
approval, it would be entitled to begin selling a generic olopatadine product
that would compete with Alcon&#8217;s <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Patanol</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font> product
in Canada well before the patent expiration in 2016, but not before expiration
of the unchallenged patent in November 2012.&#160;&#160;Such competition would
be expected to impact the Company's sales and profits.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">On April
16, 2008, Synergetics USA, Inc., a microsurgical device company, filed a civil
antitrust lawsuit in the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New
York against the Company and its subsidiary, Alcon Laboratories,
Inc.&#160;&#160;Synergetics asserts that it has suffered losses resulting from
alleged unlawful/unfair practices and seeks a recovery that it claims could
exceed $100.&#160;&#160;Synergetics alleges that Alcon has used monopoly power
in the market for vitreoretinal surgical equipment to control purchasing
decisions in favor of its surgical illumination sources and associated
accessories, and that Alcon has done this to the detriment of sales of
Synergetics's products, particularly its line of light sources, light pipes and
other accessories.&#160;&#160;Synergetics also asserts that Alcon engaged in
allegedly anti-competitive behaviors.&#160;&#160;While there can be no assurance
that an adverse outcome in the case cannot occur, the Company believes that the
Synergetics claims are without merit.&#160;&#160;On June 23, 2008, the Company
filed its answer and counterclaim in the District Court.&#160;&#160;Synergetics
subsequently amended its original Complaint, and on October 14, 2008, the
Company filed its Motion to Dismiss Synergetics's First Amended
Complaint.&#160;&#160;On February 23, 2009, the Court granted the Company's
Motion to Dismiss based on Synergetics's failure to properly plead its
claims.&#160;&#160;On March 6, 2009, Synergetics filed a Second Amended
Complaint.&#160;&#160;The Company has filed another Motion to Dismiss directed
to the Second Amended Complaint.&#160;&#160;That motion is
pending.&#160;&#160;The Company intends to vigorously defend itself in the case
and is seeking in its counterclaim to enjoin Synergetics from using Alcon trade
secrets that are believed to have been misappropriated by
Synergetics.&#160;&#160;Synergetics has filed a Motion for Summary Judgment with
respect to the counterclaim and the Company is preparing an appropriate
opposition to the motion.&#160;&#160;A trial date in 2010 is expected, but has
not yet been scheduled by the Court.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">A
subsidiary of the Company, Alcon Research, Ltd., filed a Complaint on October 9,
2008 against Synergetics USA, Inc. for patent infringement of U.S. Patent No.
5,603,710, entitled, "Laser Delivery System with Soft
Tip."&#160;&#160;</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">23</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">ALCON,
INC. AND SUBSIDIARIES</font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Notes
to Condensed Consolidated Financial Statements (Unaudited)</font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(in
millions, except share and per share data)</font></div>
            <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
          </div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The suit
was filed in the U.S. District Court for the Northern District of Texas in Fort
Worth.&#160;&#160;The Complaint asserts that Synergetics has knowingly and
willfully infringed the Company's patent, which is directed to ophthalmic laser
delivery systems having a probe with a soft tip.&#160;&#160;In addition to
seeking actual and exemplary monetary damages relating to the willful patent
infringement and injunctive relief to prevent Synergetics from continuing its
infringement of the patent, the Company is requesting that the District Court
award the Company its attorneys' fees and costs.&#160;&#160;Synergetics has
answered the Complaint and counterclaimed for a declaratory judgment of
non-infringement and patent invalidity.&#160;&#160;No trial date has been
set.&#160;&#160;An adverse ruling by the Court, while possible, would not be
expected to impact significantly the Company's sales and profits.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">On
February 25, 2009, the Company, together with subsidiaries Alcon Laboratories,
Inc. and Alcon Research, Ltd., filed a second suit against Synergetics in the
U.S. District Court in Fort Worth.&#160;&#160;This case alleges infringement of
Alcon's U.S. Patent 5,318,560 directed to aspirating laser probes, as well as
trademark infringement and unfair competition relating to Synergetics's
unauthorized use of Alcon's marks (<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">ALCON</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font>, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Accurus</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font>, and
<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Grieshaber</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font>) on its
website.&#160;&#160;On March 20, 2009, these claims were added to an amended
complaint in the '710 patent suit described immediately above, effectively
merging the two suits.&#160;&#160;An adverse ruling by the Court, while
possible, would not be expected to impact significantly the Company's sales and
profits.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">On
December 18, 2008, James M. Nielsen, M.D. filed a patent infringement suit
against Alcon, Inc. and Alcon Laboratories, Inc. in the U.S. District Court for
the Northern District of Texas in Dallas.&#160;&#160;Dr. Nielsen is asserting
that his U.S. Patent No. 5,158,572 entitled "Multifocal Intraocular Lens" is
being infringed by "instrumentalities" sold by the Company, but fails to name
any specific <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">ALCON</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font>
products.&#160;&#160;The patent, which expires at the end of October 2009, was
previously licensed to Advanced Medical Optics, Inc.&#160;&#160;Alcon filed its
Answer January 12, 2009.&#160;&#160;The Answer includes a counterclaim for a
declaratory judgment that the patent-in-suit is invalid and not
infringed.&#160;&#160;No trial date has been set.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">On
January 22, 2009, Elan Pharma International Ltd. sued two of the Company's
subsidiaries, Alcon Laboratories, Inc. and Alcon Manufacturing, Ltd., in the
U.S. District Court for the Eastern District of Texas in Sherman, alleging
infringement of two Elan patents on nanoparticle technology (U.S. Patent Nos.
5,298,262 and 5,429,842).&#160;&#160;The complaint claims that the Company's
Azopt&#174; product and, potentially, other products infringe the two
patents.&#160;&#160;The Company has not yet received formal service of process,
and consequently, its answer date is not set.&#160;&#160;Although it is still
assessing the allegations in the Elan complaint, the Company believes that it
has strong defenses and intends to defend itself vigorously if the suit is not
dismissed.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
Company and its subsidiaries are parties to a variety of other legal proceedings
arising out of the ordinary course of business, including proceedings relating
to product liability and patent infringement.&#160;&#160;The Company believes
that it has valid defenses and is vigorously defending the litigation pending
against it.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">While the
results of the aforementioned contingencies cannot be predicted with certainty,
management believes that the ultimate liability, if any, will not have a
material adverse effect on the Company's consolidated financial position or
results of operations.&#160;&#160;Litigation contingencies are subject to change
based on settlements and court decisions.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
Company may be subject to future litigation and infringement claims, which could
cause the Company to incur significant expenses or prevent the Company from
selling its products.&#160;&#160;The Company operates in an industry susceptible
to significant product liability claims.&#160;&#160;Product liability claims may
be asserted against the Company in the future arising out of events not known to
the Company at the present time.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">24</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">ITEM
2.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;MANAGEMENT'S
DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS
(UNAUDITED)</font><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
      <div align="center">
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Three
months ended March 31, 2009 compared to three months ended March 31,
2008</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
following discussion compares operations for the three months ended March 31,
2009 to operations for the three months ended March 31, 2008.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Sales</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
Company's global sales decreased 2.8% to $1,493.3 million for the three months
ended March 31, 2009 from the same period in 2008.&#160;&#160;The effect of
unfavorable exchange rates decreased global sales 7.6%.&#160;&#160;Excluding the
effect of foreign exchange fluctuations, global sales would have grown 4.8%,
primarily reflecting volume growth during the three months ended March 31,
2009.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>

              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Constant</font></div>

            <td valign="bottom" width="8%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">2009</font></div>

              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">2008</font></div>
            </td>
            <td valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;
      </font></td>
            <td valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;

              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">)</font></div>
            </td>

            </td>
            <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%">
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">)</font></div>
            </td>
            <td valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;
      </font></td>

              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">6.4</font></div>

    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" id="list" width="100%">
          <tr valign="top">
            <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 18pt">
              <div><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(a)&#160;&#160;</font></div>
            </td>
            <td>
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Change
      in constant currency (as referenced throughout this discussion) is
      determined by comparing adjusted 2009 reported amounts, calculated using
      2008 monthly average exchange rates, to the actual 2008 reported
      amounts.&#160;&#160;Sales change in constant currency is not a U.S. GAAP
      defined measure of revenue growth.&#160;&#160;Change in constant currency
      calculates sales growth without the impact of foreign exchange
      fluctuations.&#160;&#160;Management believes constant currency sales
      growth is an important measure of the Company's operations because it
      provides investors with a clearer picture of the core rate of sales growth
      attributable to changes in unit volumes and local currency
      prices.&#160;&#160;Sales change in constant currency, as defined and
      presented by the Company, may not be comparable to similar measures
      reported by other companies.</font></div>
            </td>
          </tr>
      </table>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Alcon
United States sales decreased 2.1% to $657.9 million for the three months ended
March 31, 2009, from $672.0 million for the comparable period in
2008.&#160;&#160;The decrease was mostly due to generic competition to <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">TobraDex</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font>
suspension, lower market prescription volumes, lower cataract equipment sales
and changes in retailer purchasing patterns in the consumer
business.&#160;&#160;These factors were partially offset by market share gains
in several product categories, new product introductions and sales of the
generic tobramycin/dexamethasone combination suspension.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">25</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Alcon
International sales decreased 3.4% to $835.4 million in the three months ended
March 31, 2009, from $864.4 million in the same period of 2008.&#160;&#160;The
effect of unfavorable exchange rates decreased Alcon International sales
13.6%.&#160;&#160;Excluding the effect of foreign exchange fluctuations, Alcon
International sales would have grown 10.2%, primarily reflecting volume growth
during the period.&#160;&#160;International sales grew on a constant currency
basis across all product lines.&#160;&#160;Pharmaceutical sales growth in Asia
and the organic sales growth in emerging markets were the main contributors to
this performance.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 6pt"><br></div>

      Months Ended</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>

              </td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>

      </font></td>
              <td valign="bottom" width="3%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
              <td colspan="2" valign="bottom" width="10%">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Change
      in</font></div>
              </td>

              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>

              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">210.1</font></td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>

      </font></td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">)</font></td>
              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>

              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>

Meaningful</font></div>

          <tr valign="top">
            <td align="right" style="WIDTH: 54pt">

            </td>
            <td>
              <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">See
      (a) on previous table.</font></div>
