    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 27pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Note:&#160;&#160;Certain
2008 sales details have been reclassified to conform to current period
presentation.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Pharmaceutical</font></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt"></font>Global sales of our pharmaceutical
products decreased 0.4% during the three months ended March 31,
2009.&#160;&#160;The effect of unfavorable exchange rates decreased global sales
of our pharmaceutical products 6.4%.&#160;&#160;Excluding the effect of foreign
exchange fluctuations, our sales of pharmaceutical products would have grown
6.0%.&#160;&#160;Sales of key products in most major therapeutic categories
reflected volume gains and share growth.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Our line
of glaucoma products includes <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">TRAVATAN</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font>
ophthalmic solution, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">TRAVATAN
Z</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;
</font>ophthalmic solution and <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">DuoTrav</font>&#8482; ophthalmic
solution.&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">TRAVATAN</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Z</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font> enables
doctors to help glaucoma patients with a benzalkonium chloride ("BAC") free
prostaglandin.&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">DuoTrav</font>&#8482; is a combination of
the prostaglandin analogue travoprost in <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">TRAVATAN</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font> with the
beta blocker timolol and is marketed in several European Union countries, Canada
and Australia.&#160;&#160;Combined sales of our family of <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">TRAVATAN</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font> products
grew 19.1% for the three months ended March 31, 2009, reflecting growth in the
United States and the International business segments.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">26</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">TRAVATAN</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font> growth
in the United States was favorably impacted by a decline in inventory at
wholesalers during the same time period in 2008.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">During
the three months ended March 31, 2009, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Azopt</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font>
ophthalmic suspension, the Company's topical carbonic anhydrase inhibitor,
posted a 4.5% sales increase.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Sales of
<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Vigamox</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font>
ophthalmic solution, our leading anti-infective fluoroquinolone drug, decreased
11.5% compared to 2008, primarily due to a contracting U.S. anti-infective
prescription market, which was partially offset by International<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic"> Vigamox</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174; </font>sales
growth of 9.7% (19.6% excluding the 9.9% negative effect of foreign exchange
fluctuations).&#160;&#160;(Moxifloxacin<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">, </font>the primary ingredient in
<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Vigamox</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font>, is
licensed to Alcon by Bayer HealthCare AG.)&#160;&#160;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">NEVANAC</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font>
ophthalmic suspension is our non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drug ("NSAID") for
the treatment of pain and inflammation associated with cataract
surgery.&#160;&#160;Sales of <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">NEVANAC</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font> grew
4.5% in the three months ended March 31, 2009 over the same period of the prior
year, from growth outside the United States.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Pursuant
to a prior legal settlement, a competitor of Alcon&#8217;s launched a generic version
of <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">TobraDex</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font>
ophthalmic suspension on January 1, 2009.&#160;&#160;Falcon Pharmaceuticals, our
generic pharmaceutical subsidiary, also launched a generic version of <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">TobraDex</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font>
suspension on January 2, 2009.&#160;&#160;During the three months ended March
31, 2009, sales of <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">TobraDex</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font>
ophthalmic suspension and ointment, our branded combination drug for the
treatment of infection and inflammation, decreased 39.7% globally, primarily
within the United States, over the same period of 2008.&#160;&#160;We expect
that these generic products will result in a decline of our sales and profits
for <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">TobraDex</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font>.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Despite
contraction in the U.S. allergy market, global sales of our leading allergy
products, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Patanol</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font> and
<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Pataday</font>&#8482; ophthalmic
solutions, grew 9.4% in the three months ended March 31, 2009.&#160;&#160;All of
the increase in sales reflected growth outside the United States; however, we
continued to expand market share in the contracting U.S. market.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Sales of
otic/nasal products increased 14.2% in the three months ended March 31, 2009
over the same period of 2008, despite contraction in the market for otic
products.&#160;&#160;This increase was attributable to sales of the Company&#8217;s
new nasal allergy product, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Patanase</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font> nasal
spray.&#160;&#160;The initial distribution and U.S. launch of <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Patanase</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font> began
subsequent to its Food and Drug Administration approval in April
2008.&#160;&#160;Sales of <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">CIPRODEX</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174; </font>otic
suspension were positively influenced by market share gains, which partially
offset a decrease in U.S. otic segment volume during 2009.&#160;&#160;(<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">CIPRODEX</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font> is a
registered trademark of Bayer AG, licensed to Alcon by Bayer HealthCare
AG.)</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
change in the other pharmaceuticals/rebates line for the period ended March 31,
2009, compared to 2008, reflects growth in rebates under U.S. government
programs attributable to increasing utilization rates and higher discounts
required to maintain formulary status.&#160;&#160;It also reflects a shift in
product mix towards higher discounted products in our commercial and Medicare
Part D programs.&#160;&#160;There also were increased provisions for coupon
discounts on direct-to-consumer advertising.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Surgical</font></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Global
sales of our surgical products declined 3.5% to $673.7 million in the three
months ended March 31, 2009, compared to 2008.&#160;&#160;The effect of
unfavorable exchange rates decreased global sales of our surgical products
8.7%.&#160;&#160;Excluding the effect of foreign exchange fluctuations, our
sales of surgical products would have increased 5.2%.&#160;&#160;Higher sales of
intraocular lenses, as well as cataract and vitreoretinal products (which
include surgical equipment, devices and disposable products), accounted for the
constant currency growth.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Sales of
intraocular lenses decreased 4.8% in the three months ended March 31, 2009 over
the same period in 2008.&#160;&#160;Excluding the effect of foreign exchange
fluctuations, intraocular lens sales increased 4.4%.&#160;&#160;Although we
continued to see some pressure on cataract procedure and advanced technology
intraocular lens segment&#160;&#160;growth&#160;&#160;due to global economic
conditions, global sales of our advanced technology products, such as the <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">AcrySof</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174; </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">ReSTOR</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font>
multifocal intraocular lens that corrects presbyopia and the <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">AcrySof</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174; </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Toric</font> intraocular lens that
corrects pre-existing astigmatism, grew 9.7%, excluding the 8.9% negative effect
of foreign exchange fluctuations that held the reported sales increase to 0.8%
in the three months ended March 31, 2009, compared to 2008.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br>&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">27</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Sales of
other surgical products were adversely impacted by exchange rates but grew
faster on a constant currency basis in the international markets due to growth
of phaco surgery in emerging markets, increased acceptance of advanced
technology products and the introduction of products in additional
markets.&#160;&#160;The growth </font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">came from
solid constant currency sales growth across all major product categories within
the cataract and vitreoretinal segments.</font></div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Refractive
sales declined 19.5% to $25.2 million for the three months ended March 31,
2009.&#160;&#160;Refractive sales for 2009 decreased as a result of a decline in
procedures attributable primarily to economic conditions in the United
States.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Consumer Eye
Care</font></font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Our
global consumer eye care sales, consisting of contact lens care solutions,
artificial tears and other general eye care products, decreased 7.9% to $193.5
million in the three months ended March 31, 2009, compared to $210.1 million in
the three months ended March 31, 2008.&#160;&#160;The effect of unfavorable
exchange rates decreased global sales of our consumer eye care products
8.0%.&#160;&#160;Excluding the effect of foreign exchange fluctuations, our
sales of consumer eye care products would have increased 0.1%.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Sales of
our contact lens disinfectants declined 7.2% in the three months ended March 31,
2009 compared to the same period in 2008, with the majority of the decline
experienced in the United States due to inventory reductions at major retailers
during the current period and a decline in the market for branded multi-purpose
solutions.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Sales of
our artificial tears products decreased 1.2% over the same period in
2008.&#160;&#160;The decrease is attributable to foreign exchange
fluctuations.&#160;&#160;Constant currency sales of our artificial tears
products, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Systane</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font> and
<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Systane</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font> <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Ultra </font>lubricant eye drops,
improved in both the United States and International business
segments.&#160;&#160;A portion of the improvement is due to the launch of <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Systane</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font> <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">Ultra</font> in the United States in
July 2008.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Gross
Profit</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Gross
profit increased slightly to $1,138.6 million in the three months ended March
31, 2009 from $1,138.1 million in 2008.&#160;&#160;Gross profit increased as a
percent of sales to 76.2% in the three months ended March 31, 2009 from 74.1% in
2008.&#160;&#160;Gross profit margin improved as a result of the temporary
effect of differences in foreign currency exchange rates between the first
quarters of 2009 and 2008.&#160;&#160;Favorable product sales mix variations and
manufacturing efficiencies also contributed to the improvement.&#160;&#160;In
addition, the first three months of 2008 included costs associated with the
WaveLight AG integration that were not incurred in the first three months of
2009.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Operating
Expenses</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Selling,
general and administrative expenses decreased 2.5% to $472.1 million in the
three months ended March 31, 2009 from $484.2 million in
2008.&#160;&#160;Selling, general and administrative expenses increased slightly
as a percentage of sales to 31.6% from 31.5% in 2008.&#160;&#160;In 2009, we
experienced the costs of sales force additions in selected Asian and European
countries, as well as lapping costs of prior year sales force additions in the
United States, Japan and emerging markets to support new product launches and/or
increased direct selling share-of-voice competitiveness, bad debts provisions
and the in-period costs of the reduction in other workforce.&#160;&#160;These
costs were offset by the favorable effects of foreign currency fluctuations,
lower share-based payments expense and reductions in spending
programs.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Research
and development expenses increased 1.0% to $146.3 million (or 9.8% of sales) in
the three months ended March 31, 2009 from $144.9 million (or 9.4% of sales) in
2008.&#160;&#160;The increase in research and development expenses represented a
continued investment across pharmaceutical, surgical and consumer eye care
product lines.&#160;&#160;In-period costs for reductions in workforce were
mostly offset by decreases in share-based payments expense.&#160;&#160;The
relatively modest increase in research and development expenses was also
affected by project timing.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">28</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
      <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Amortization
of intangibles decreased to $6.6 million in the three months ended March 31,
2009, from $8.9 million in 2008.&#160;&#160;Certain paid-up licenses became
fully amortized in 2008, reducing amortization expense.</font></div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br>&#160;</div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Operating
Income</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Operating
income increased 2.7% to $513.6 million in the three months ended March 31, 2009
from $500.1 million in 2008.&#160;&#160;This improvement in 2009 reflected the
decrease in operating expenses discussed above.&#160;&#160;Share-based
compensation expense decreased operating income by $23.0 million and $34.0
million in the three months ended March 31, 2009 and 2008,
respectively.&#160;&#160;Because some awards were expensed on their grant date
in February 2009, share-based compensation in the three months ended March 31,
2009 represents approximately 30% of the expected share-based compensation
expense to be recognized in the full year 2009.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Alcon
United States business segment operating income decreased 3.7% to $352.8
million, or 53.6% of sales, in the three months ended March 31, 2009 from $366.5
million, or 54.5% of sales, in 2008.&#160;&#160;Operating income as a percent of
sales declined in 2009 as a result of lower sales volume, primarily from generic
competition to TobraDex<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 70%; VERTICAL-ALIGN: super">&#174;</font>, and
product mix.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Alcon
International business segment operating income increased 8.8% to $379.0
million, or 45.4% of sales, in the three months ended March 31, 2009 from $348.3
million, or 40.3% of sales in 2008.&#160;&#160;In 2009, the operating income
margin improved as result of the temporary effect of differences in foreign
currency exchange rates between the first quarters of 2009 and 2008, favorable
product sales mix on gross margin as a percent of sales and improved operating
expense ratio leverage.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Operating
income for the Alcon United States and Alcon International business segments
does not include: (1) certain manufacturing costs (e.g., manufacturing operation
period costs and manufacturing variances); (2) research and development costs
other than regulatory costs; (3) certain other general corporate expenses; and
(4) share-based compensation.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Interest
and Other Income (Expenses)</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Interest
income decreased 56.8% to $11.1 million in the three months ended March 31, 2009
from $25.7 million in 2008, primarily as a result of lower short term interest
rates, partially offset by higher balances of cash and cash equivalents in
2009.&#160;&#160;Interest expense decreased 69.5% to $5.3 million in the three
months ended March 31, 2009 from $17.4 million in 2008, resulting from lower
borrowings and decreased interest rates.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Other,
net, included gains (losses) on investments for the three months ended March 31,
2009 and 2008 as follows:</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
      <div align="left">
        <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
            <tr>
              <td valign="bottom" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;

                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Three
      months&#160;ended March 31,</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td valign="bottom" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;
      </font></td>
              <td valign="bottom" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
              <td colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">2009</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
              <td valign="bottom" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
              <td colspan="2" valign="bottom" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 2px solid">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">2008</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 2px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
            </tr>
            <tr>
              <td valign="bottom"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;
      </font></td>
              <td colspan="7" valign="bottom">

      millions)</font></div>

              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="76%">

      losses on sale of investments</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="1%"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>

              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="76%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px">
                <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">Total</font></div>
              </td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>

              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">3.9</font></td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">&#160;</font></td>
              <td align="left" valign="bottom" width="1%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">$</font></td>
              <td align="right" valign="bottom" width="9%" style="BORDER-BOTTOM: black 4px double"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">(10.8</font></td>
              <td align="left" nowrap valign="bottom" width="1%" style="PADDING-BOTTOM: 4px"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: times new roman">)</font></td>
            </tr>
        </table>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Alcon and
its subsidiaries invest cash generated from operations to fund ongoing operating
expenses, research and development and long term corporate
liabilities.&#160;&#160;The majority of the funds needed to accommodate expenses
and liabilities are invested in cash and cash equivalents, the income from which
is recorded in interest income.&#160;&#160;The Company's long term liabilities
are evaluated with the help of outside consultants and are offset by a portfolio
of investments with similar durations and appropriate hurdle rates.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">29</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Despite
the significant weighting to cash, the Company had material exposure during the
first quarters of 2009 and 2008 to the following investment markets: fixed
income securities, hedge funds, senior secured bank loans funds, equities and
real estate investment trusts.&#160;&#160;The Company sold its investments in
real estate investment trusts, fixed income securities and a portion of the
senior secured bank loans funds portfolio in the first quarter of
2009.&#160;&#160;The realized losses on sale of investments in the three months
ended March 31, 2009 reflect the sale of these instruments, for which the
majority of the losses were recognized as unrealized losses on trading
securities during fiscal year 2008.&#160;&#160;The Company also has requested
redemption of its investments in hedge funds and expects to receive the majority
of those proceeds throughout 2009.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Income
Tax Expense</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Income
tax expense decreased to $61.6 million in the three months ended March 31, 2009
from $74.1 million in the same period of 2008.&#160;&#160;The effective tax rate
was 12.0% in the three months ended March 31, 2009, compared to 14.7% in the
three months ended March 31, 2008.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The lower
effective tax rate for the three months ended March 31, 2009 reflected
differences in product and geographic earnings mix, including a larger share of
research and development funding from the United States, greater net benefits
associated with the expansion of the Company&#8217;s global administration operations
in Switzerland and the passage of the research and experimentation credit in the
fourth quarter of 2008.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Net
Earnings</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Net
earnings increased 5.3% to $452.0 million in the three months ended March 31,
2009 from $429.4 million in 2008.&#160;&#160;This increase resulted from 2009
reductions in operating expenses and income taxes.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Liquidity
and Capital Resources</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Cash,
Debt and Liquidity</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">At March
31, 2009, the Company reported cash and cash equivalents of $3,090.7 million,
short term borrowings and total debt of $1,188.3 million and consolidated
shareholders' equity of $5,106.1 million.&#160;&#160;As part of our cash
management strategy, the Company maintains large balances of cash and cash
equivalents in Switzerland and Bermuda, while the Company's debt is borrowed in
subsidiary operating companies located elsewhere.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">A portion
of the Company's assets was held and invested through an irrevocable Rabbi trust
in an unfunded arrangement for the payment of benefits to participants under
certain defined benefit pension plans of the Company.&#160;&#160;At March 31,
2009, the accompanying condensed consolidated balance sheet included net assets
of the trust (cash and cash equivalents of $34.8 million, short term investments
of $220.2 million and long term investments of $18.9 million) that were
restricted to the payment of pension benefits except under certain conditions,
such as the Company's insolvency or termination of the trust.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In order
to receive an expedited return of assets held by Lehman Brothers International
(Europe) London (in administration) as discussed in note 3 to the condensed
consolidated financial statements, Alcon has agreed to return any assets which
the Joint Administrators determine should not have been disbursed in
settlement.&#160;&#160;The amount of funds to be returned, if any, would result
from the determination by the Joint Administrators that the rights of another
claimant in the proceeding have precedence over the Company's
claim.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Contingencies</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">As
further discussed in note 14 to the condensed consolidated financial statements,
the Company and its subsidiaries are parties to a variety of other legal
proceedings arising out of the ordinary course of business,</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">30</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">including
proceedings relating to product liability and patent
infringement.&#160;&#160;The Company believes that it has valid defenses and is
vigorously defending the litigation pending against it.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">While the
results of the aforementioned contingencies cannot be predicted with certainty,
management believes that the ultimate liability, if any, will not have a
material adverse effect on the Company&#8217;s consolidated financial position or
results of operations.&#160;&#160;Litigation contingencies are subject to change
based on settlements and court decisions.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Cash
Flows</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">During
the three months ended March 31, 2009, the Company generated operating cash flow
of $411.7 million, compared to $398.1 million in 2008.&#160;&#160;The increase
primarily reflected the Company's net earnings improvement in 2009, less some
reduction for increased working capital.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Investing
Activities</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Net cash
provided by investing activities in the three months ended March 31, 2009 was
$120.7 million, compared to $68.6 million used in investing activities in
2008.&#160;&#160;Sales and maturities of investments provided cash from
investing activities to a greater extent in 2009 than in 2008, as certain
adjustments were made in the investment portfolio.&#160;&#160;Capital
expenditures in 2009 were comparable to 2008.&#160;&#160;Our capital
expenditures were made principally to expand and upgrade our manufacturing and
research and development facilities and other infrastructure.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In 2009,
we broke ground to build a facility in Singapore that will manufacture
pharmaceuticals to be distributed throughout most of Asia.&#160;&#160;We plan
for the 250,000 square foot facility to be fully functional in
2012.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Financing
Activities</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">During
the three months ended March 31, 2009, we increased our short term borrowings by
$72.4 million.&#160;&#160;Our short term borrowings are discussed more fully
under "Credit and Commercial Paper Facilities" below.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
February 2009, approximately 1.2 million employee share-settled stock
appreciation rights and over 150,000 employee stock options became
exercisable.&#160;&#160;The exercise price of $122.90 per share applicable to
these instruments was greater than the market price on that date and through the
date of this report.&#160;&#160;During 2009, approximately 92,570 stock options
were exercised, providing proceeds of $4.8 million to the Company.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">We intend
to issue new common shares from conditional capital for the exercise of stock
options held by employees that were granted in 2002 and 2003, as well as for
share-based awards granted after December 31, 2007.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Since
2002, the Company's board of directors has authorized the purchase on the open
market of up to 27 million Alcon common shares to, among other things, satisfy
the exercise of equity awards granted to employees that are scheduled to become
exercisable in 2007 through 2012.&#160;&#160;To the extent such share purchases
are not required for employee awards, the board may present the shares for
approval of cancellation at future shareholders' meetings.&#160;&#160;Through
March 31, 2009, we cumulatively have purchased approximately 25.4 million Alcon
common shares (including approximately 50,000 shares in 2009) for $2,703.6
million (including $4.1 million in 2009).</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 18pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">In
December 2008, as a result of the agreement between Nestl&#233; S.A. and Novartis AG
discussed in note 13 to the condensed consolidated financial statements, the
Company discontinued the purchase of Alcon common shares in the open market
under all share repurchase programs.&#160;&#160;However, the Company continues
to acquire shares withheld from employees' exercises of share-based awards to
cover their taxes.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt"></font>On May 5, 2009, Alcon's shareholders
will consider a proposal by our board of directors to cancel 1,043,400 Alcon
common shares that were purchased as treasury shares and to reduce Alcon's share
capital by a corresponding amount.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">31</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt"></font>The payment of dividends is subject to
the availability of retained earnings or dividendable reserves under Swiss law,
the proposal by our board of directors, and ultimately the approval of our
shareholders.&#160;&#160;Future dividend payments will depend on various
factors, including our net earnings, financial condition, cash requirements,
future prospects and other factors deemed relevant by our board of directors in
their proposal for approval to the shareholders.&#160;&#160;On February 10,
2009, Alcon's board of directors voted to propose to shareholders the payment of
a dividend of CHF 3.95 per common share, or approximately $3.47 per common share
at the exchange rate in effect on March 31, 2009, totaling an estimated $1,060.5
million depending on exchange rates.&#160;&#160;If the proposed dividend is
approved by the shareholders at their annual general meeting on May 5, 2009, we
expect that it will be paid on or about May 28, 2009.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Capital
Resources</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt"></font>We expect to meet our current working
capital and liquidity needs, including the approximately
$1,060.5&#160;&#160;million anticipated dividend payment subject to shareholder
approval, primarily through cash and cash equivalents, the liquidation of short
term investments, and, to the extent necessary, short term
borrowings.&#160;&#160;We expect to meet future liquidity requirements through
operating cash flows and through issuances of commercial paper under the
facility described below or other debt, the combination of which we believe
would be sufficient, even if our sales were adversely affected as compared to
expectations.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Credit
and Commercial Paper Facilities</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt"></font>As of March 31, 2009, the Company had
credit and commercial paper facilities totaling approximately $2.9 billion
available worldwide, including a $2.0 billion commercial paper
facility.&#160;&#160;As of March 31, 2009, $701.2 million of the commercial
paper was outstanding at an average interest rate of 0.4% before
fees.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt"></font>Nestl&#233; guarantees the commercial paper
facility and assists in its management, for which we pay Nestl&#233; an annual fee
based on the average outstanding commercial paper balances.&#160;&#160;In
addition, we pay Nestl&#233; a fee for serving as a guarantor on a bank loan for
Japanese yen 5.0 billion ($50.8 million) maturing in 2011 arranged by ABN AMRO
for our subsidiary in Japan.&#160;&#160;Nestl&#233;'s guarantees permit us to obtain
more favorable interest rates, based upon Nestl&#233;'s credit rating, than might
otherwise be obtained.&#160;&#160;We believe that any fees paid by us to Nestl&#233;
for its guaranty of any indebtedness or for the management of the commercial
paper program are comparable to the fees that would be paid in an arm's-length
transaction.&#160;&#160;The loan contains a provision that may accelerate the
obligations in the event that Nestl&#233;'s ownership of Alcon falls below
51%.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt"></font>The Company also had available
commitments of $289.2 million under unsecured revolving credit facilities with
Nestl&#233; and its affiliates; at March 31, 2009, $93.6 million was outstanding
under these credit facilities.&#160;&#160;Alcon's subsidiaries had third-party
lines of credit, including bank overdraft facilities, totaling approximately
$628.0 million under which there was an aggregate outstanding balance of $337.1
million at March 31, 2009.&#160;&#160;Most of the credit facilities with Nestl&#233;
and third parties have terms for less than one year and accrue interest at a
rate consistent with local borrowing rates.&#160;&#160;In aggregate, these
facilities had a weighted average interest rate of 3.3% at March 31,
2009.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-STYLE: italic; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Valuation
of Financial Instruments</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt"></font>Effective January 1, 2008, the Company
adopted SFAS No. 157, "Fair Value Measurements."&#160;&#160;SFAS No. 157 defines
fair value, establishes a framework for measuring fair value, establishes a fair
value hierarchy based on the inputs used to measure fair value and enhances
disclosure requirements for fair value measurements.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt"></font>The Company has hired investment
managers to invest funds in liquid, short term high-quality fixed income
investments or equity securities.&#160;&#160;The portfolios are held at a global
custodian and priced using broker/dealer quotes in active
markets.&#160;&#160;The pricing on these securities has not been adjusted by the
Company.&#160;&#160;We have reviewed our global custodian's pricing source
hierarchy, which details the preferred pricing source for each asset
class.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt">
      <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
        <div id="FTR">
          <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">32</font></div>
          <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
        <div id="HDR">
          <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
        </div>
      </div>
    </div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Additionally,
our global custodian utilizes a combination of indicative bid and ask/offer
quotes to price these securities.&#160;&#160;Due to the nature of the pricing
sources, the Company has classified these investments as either Level 1 or Level
2.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 8pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt"></font>As indicated in note 5 to the condensed
consolidated financial statements, financial assets presented at fair value and
categorized as Level 3 were corporate investments held in funds professionally
managed by investment advisors.&#160;&#160;These Level 3 financial assets were
marked to net asset values furnished in statements received from fund
custodians, who reflect valuations conducted according to their respective fund
pricing policies and asset types.&#160;&#160;The Company evaluated these pricing
policies utilized by the investment advisors and validated certain fair value
measurements.</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font id="TAB1" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 18pt"></font>The financial assets presented at fair
value and categorized as Level 3 were generally consistent at March 31, 2009, as
compared with December 31, 2008.&#160;&#160;There were no financial liabilities
categorized as Level 3 at the reporting dates.&#160;&#160;The table presented
below summarized the Company's Level 3 assets at March 31, 2009 and December 31,
2008:</font></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>
    <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; LINE-HEIGHT: 11.4pt"><br></div>

      31,</font></div>

      3 derivative liabilities</font></div>
              </td>
